page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF AREA
page.content: The block assigned to us covers the northern part of Lincoln, an area sometimes referred to as "uphill Lincoln". It excludes Lincoln's famous landmarks, the Cathedral and Castle, but contains the historic Bail area and Newport Arch. The area is predominantly residential with a wide mix of housing types. There are areas of nineteenth century terraced housing, off Monks Road and Burton Road and areas of expensive middle and upper class housing near the Cathedral. There are two large council housing estates, St. Giles and the Ermine Estate. The area contains one of Lincoln's two main hospitals, several schools, a sports centre, a museum, the prison but little industry. Lincoln's main shopping area lies to the south, to the west is the Common and north merges into farmland.
